title: rustdoc CSS does not reset `line-height` to a non-zero value in `<pre>`.

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-rustdoc-themes
labels.description: Area: themes for HTML pages generated by rustdoc

body:
Due to GitHub's strict limitations on HTML styling, one of the few ways I found to reduce font size has been the use of `<sub>`/`<sup>` tags. *However*, I recently stumbled upon a difference between GFM and rustdoc's theming:

|[on GitHub](https://github.com/EmbarkStudios/spirt/tree/0.1.0#simple-example-with-non-trivial-control-flow)|[on crates.io](https://crates.io/crates/spirt/0.1.0#user-content-simple-example-with-non-trivial-control-flow) (rustdoc also identical)|
|-|-|
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/77424/208470212-708c74c4-af26-45dd-b49a-a3fa3ce166f0.png) | ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/77424/208470353-7d2ad5b2-91b7-4f45-a9cf-7ce8891a009e.png)

To reproduce, this should be sufficient:
````md
<sub>

```
one
two
three
```

</sub>
````

---

AFAICT, the difference is due to `line-height`: `<sub>`/`<sup>` set it to `0`, and on GitHub we also have:
```css
.markdown-body .highlight pre, .markdown-body pre {
  /* ... */
  line-height: 1.45;
  /* ... */
}
```

But rustdoc's `normalize.css` doesn't set `line-height` to anything in its `code, kbd, pre, samp {...}` rule.
I would suggest either `line-height: normal` or `line-height: 1.15` (the latter is what it does for `html`).

(I hope crates.io uses rustdoc, otherwise this bug is basically duplicated to two uses of `normalize.css`)
